intro: Melicope doormani-montis, commonly known as the Doormani-Montis melicope, is a tropical plant native to the island of Mauritius. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with a glossy surface and a distinct, aromatic scent. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by woody, spherical fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
